edge: Kaal is a 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film written and directed by Soham Shah.
Soham Shah directed the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal.
Karan Johar jointly produced the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal with Shah Rukh Khan.
Shah Rukh Khan jointly produced the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal with Karan Johar.
Ajay Devgn starred in the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal.
John Abraham starred in the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal.
Vivek Oberoi starred in the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal.
Esha Deol starred in the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal.
Lara Dutta starred in the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal.

The story of the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal focuses on a group of people fighting for their lives against a mysterious entity in the fictional Orbit National Park, alluding to the world-famous Jim Corbett National Park, Nainital, Uttarakhand.
In the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal, National Geographic sends a correspondent named Krish Thapar to the national park to ascertain what really happened.
In the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal, Krish Thapar is accompanied by his wife Riya.

In the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal, a group of youngsters consisting of Dev Malhotra, his girlfriend Ishika, and others fight for their lives against a mysterious entity in the fictional Orbit National Park.

In the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal, Dev Malhotra is accompanied by his girlfriend Ishika while fighting for their lives against a mysterious entity in the fictional Orbit National Park.
In the 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film Kaal, several other tiger attacks occur after two British nationals are killed by a ferocious tiger in Corbett National Park.

are saved by a mysterious man who introduces himself as Kaali Pratap Singh
The group enters the jungle after passing through a lake.
Three tigers appear on the way while the group is traveling through the jungle.
Kaali saves the group from being confronted by wild animals.
The road is blocked due to a landslide caused by rain.
Kaali agrees to lead the group out of the jungle after finding the road blocked.
Kaali claims to live in the jungle and is knowledgeable about its history.
Kaali tells a story about a crazy tour guide who leads tourists to the wrong places in this jungle and gets them killed by wild animals.
People in nearby villages catch the crazy tour guide and beat him to death.
The ghost of the crazy tour guide remains in the jungle and continues to kill tourists.
Bagga disappears while repairing his car, causing fear among the rest of the group members.
Vishal is decapitated shortly thereafter when a window of their car flies and hits him due to an explosion.
The group reaches a deserted guesthouse near which there is a well.
Riya gets water from the well despite being warned not to get close to it by Kaali and accidentally hangs herself in the well and dies.
Kaali warns the group about Riya's accidental death in the well, and later Riya dies due to being accidentally hung by her foot in the well.
The remaining group members figure out that Riya is dead and try to pull her body out from the well.

Dev sends Kaali away by asking him to gather some timbers which can be used to perform Riya's final rites, but Dev realizes that Kaali is a ghost and responsible for all the mysterious deaths happening in the jungle.
Dev checks all the videos recorded by Vishal and realizes that Kaali is not visible in any of them, confirming that Kaali is a ghost.
Krish and Ishika realize that Kaali is a ghost responsible for the mysterious deaths in the jungle, and decide to escape the jungle once and for all.
The story reveals that the villagers did not kill Kaali but instead took him to the core area where he was brutally thrashed and then thrown in front of a hungry tiger that mauled him to death.
Kaali's ghost expresses his anger and hatred for tourists who come to the jungle to hunt wild animals and disrupt their well being without any regrets.
For tourists who come to the jungle to hunt wild animals, Kaali misleads them before killing them, disrupting their well being without any regrets.
